00034 #ifndef __ExampleApplication_H__
00035 #define __ExampleApplication_H__
00036 
00037 #include "Ogre.h"
00038 #include "OgreConfigFile.h"
00039 #include "ExampleFrameListener.h"
00040 
00041 
00042 using namespace Ogre;
00043 
00047 class ExampleApplication
00048 {
00049   public:
00051     ExampleApplication ()
00052     {
00053         mFrameListener = 0;
00054         mRoot = 0;
00055     }
00057     void go (int resX, int resY)
00058     {
00059         mRoot = new Root ();
00060         setupResources ();
00061         if ( !configure (resX, resY))
00062         return /*false*/;
00063         chooseSceneManager ();
00064         createCamera ();
00065         createViewports ();
00066         // Set default mipmap level (NB some APIs ignore this)
00067         TextureManager::getSingleton ().setDefaultNumMipMaps (5);
00068         // Create the scene
00069         createScene ();
00070         createFrameListener ();
00071         return /*true*/;
00072     }
00073 
00074 //  protected:
00075     Root * mRoot;
00076     Camera *mCamera;
00077     SceneManager *mSceneMgr;
00078     ExampleFrameListener *mFrameListener;
00079     RenderWindow *mWindow;
00080 
00081 
00083      ~ExampleApplication ()
00084     {
00085         if (mFrameListener)
00086             delete mFrameListener;
00087         if (mRoot)
00088             delete mRoot;
00089 /*  if (mCamera)
00090         delete mCamera;
00091     if (mWindow)
00092         delete mWindow;
00093     if (mSceneMgr)
00094         delete mSceneMgr;*/
00095     }
00096 
00097     // These internal methods package up the stages in the startup process
00098 
00102     bool configure (int resX, int resY)
00103     {
00104         // Show the configuration dialog and initialise the system
00105         // You can skip this and use root.restoreConfig() to load configuration
00106         // settings if you were sure there are valid ones saved in ogre.cfg
00107 //        if(mRoot->showConfigDialog())
00108         if (manualInitialize ("OpenGL",resX,resY))
00109         {
00110             // If returned true, user clicked OK so initialise
00111             // Here we choose to let the system create a default rendering window by passing 'true'
00112             mWindow = mRoot->initialise (true);
00113             return true;
00114         }
00115         else
00116         {
00117             return false;
00118         }
00119     }
00120 
00121     void chooseSceneManager (void)
00122     {
00123         // Get the SceneManager, in this case a generic one
00124         mSceneMgr = mRoot->getSceneManager (ST_GENERIC);
00125     }
00126     void createCamera (void)
00127     {
00128         // Create the camera
00129         mCamera = mSceneMgr->createCamera ("PlayerCam");
00130 
00131         // Position it at 500 in Z direction
00132         mCamera->setPosition (Vector3 (0, 0, 500));
00133         // Look back along -Z
00134         mCamera->lookAt (Vector3 (0, 0, -300));
00135         mCamera->setNearClipDistance (5);
00136 
00137     }
00138     bool manualInitialize (const String & desiredRenderer,int resX, int resY)
00139     {
00140         RenderSystem *renderSystem;
00141         bool ok = false;
00142 
00143         RenderSystemList *renderers = Root::getSingleton ().getAvailableRenderers ();
00144 
00145         // See if the list is empty (no renderers available)
00146         if (renderers->empty ())
00147             return false;
00148 
00149         for (RenderSystemList::iterator it = renderers->begin (); it != renderers->end (); it++)
00150         {
00151             renderSystem = (*it);
00152             if (strstr (&(*renderSystem->getName ()), &(*desiredRenderer)))
00153             {
00154                 ok = true;
00155                 break;
00156             }
00157         }
00158 
00159         if (!ok)
00160         {
00161             // We still don't have a renderer; pick up the first one from the list
00162             renderSystem = (*renderers->begin ());
00163         }
00164 
00165         Root::getSingleton ().setRenderSystem (renderSystem);
00166     char resolution[32];
00167     sprintf(resolution,"%i x %i",resX,resY);
00168 
00169         // Manually set configuration options. These are optional.
00170         renderSystem->setConfigOption ("Video Mode", resolution);
00171 
00172         return true;
00173     }
00174 
00175     void createFrameListener (void)
00176     {
00177         mFrameListener = new ExampleFrameListener (mWindow, mCamera);
00178         mFrameListener->showDebugOverlay (true);
00179         mRoot->addFrameListener (mFrameListener);
00180     }
00181 
00182     void createScene (void)     // pure virtual - this has to be overridden
00183     {
00184         mSceneMgr->setSkyBox (true, "MotorsportSkyBox");
00185     }
00186 
00187 
00188     virtual void createViewports (void)
00189     {
00190         // Create one viewport, entire window
00191         Viewport *vp = mWindow->addViewport (mCamera);
00192 
00193         vp->setBackgroundColour (ColourValue (0, 0, 0));
00194     }
00195 
00197     virtual void setupResources (void)
00198     {
00199         // Load resource paths from config file
00200         ConfigFile cf;
00201 
00202         cf.load ("resources.cfg");
00203 
00204         // Go through all settings in the file
00205         ConfigFile::SettingsIterator i = cf.getSettingsIterator ();
00206 
00207         String typeName, archName;
00208 
00209         while (i.hasMoreElements ())
00210         {
00211             typeName = i.peekNextKey ();
00212             archName = i.getNext ();
00213             ResourceManager::addCommonArchiveEx (archName, typeName);
00214         }
00215     }
00216

00218 
00219 };
